content.content: Unemployment continues to spiral upwards. The strength of the CEDA continues to rise.
A works program has been enacted in order to reduce unemployment.
However, unemployment remains too high for comfort.
There is little to no good news in Germany. The economic depression has still not bottomed out.
We have begun to launch a public works program, but unemployment is still stubbornly high. The people are beginning to finally have optimism, however.
We have begun to launch a public works program, and unemployment is finally starting to fall. The people are beginning to finally have optimism.
The presidential election is in April of this year.
New year new me!!!!
New year new me!!!!
New year new me!!!!
New year new me!!!!

options.title: Game over.

content.content: It is the end of 1933, and the CEDA still has not taken power. It appears that we have already passed the worst of the years of crisis. We are turning the corner on the Great Depression, and Nazism's days are numbered.
Perhaps Germany will finally enter into a new era of genuine stability...

We need the support of the works councils first.

If the capitalists are going to attack us, then we must hit them back. We have empowered the workers to seize and take full control of the factories that the capitalists have idled. The fascists, of course, call us thieves and looters.

We condmen the events that have happened in Casas Viejas, but we nontheless attempt to protect Azaña and the goverment from the attacks of being reactionary or incompetent. This leaves us open to attacks from our left but Azaña and the left Republicans thank us profusely.

Our policy choices have greatly offended the Centrist faction. Many of our most experienced leaders have resigned.
Ludwig Kaas has been selected as the chairman of the Center Party. He seems to represent a rightward turn from Marx, and will preside over a Center Party less inclined to compromise with the left.

cnt_fai_reaproches.title: CNT_FAI reaproaches us.
cnt_fai_reaproches.subtitle: The CNT FAI has approached us in a conciliatory manner.

content.content: CNT FAI has declared us allies in the fight for socialism.

The relationship between the CNT FAI and the PSOE have never been quite good, they consider us too conciliatory towards the burgoise republic and the liberal parties. Nontheless, one way or another, they have been convinced of our good intentions. Let the forces of reaction tremble for the biggest socialist forces of Spain are united.

ceda_formed.title: The Catholic Right consolidates.
ceda_formed.subtitle: After a short period of disorganization after the end of the Monarchy the right is back on its feet.

content.content: The right has been splintered since the beggining of the republic, divided on matters of the monarchy, economy, methods, and past grudges. Nontheless, after a period of struggle, the agrarians, the catholics, political groups we have disgruntled and many others have joined together. The nucleus of the party is the AP, Action Party. The Confederacion Española de Derechas Autonomas (Spanish Confederation of the Autonomous Right), is led by Gil Robles, a staunch clericalist, with strong support from the Church and the countryside.

There are perhaps some positive news about this new giant, the CEDA mantains an accidentalist position in the face of the Republic-Monarchy question, supposedly mantaining neutrality on this matter. This has caused the monarchist hardliners to leave and form Renovacion Española, a far right corporatist monarchist party. In any case, this is a matter of worry, the right has begun consolidating, they look for massive gains next election...

options.title: Appeal to the Reichswehr to stand down.

Call a general strike!
Call up the loyal portions of the police.
Now, the battle...

content.content: Gustav Stresemann, leader of the PRP, has died. He was the primary force driving the party to support democracy; without him, the democratic forces in the Republic will be so much weaker.

cnt_fai_rejects.subtitle: The CNT FAIs annoyance with our methods have reached boiling point.

content.content: CNT FAI has declared us counter revolutionary.

Unfortunatly, it would seem the two biggest worker movements in Spain have not been able to hold together. The CNT FAI have grown tired of us and have declared us traitors and counterrevolutionaries to the proletariat, let us hope they do not go further than declarations.

The far-right parties and paramilitaries - the FE_JONS (and its paramilitary the SA), the Stahlhelm paramilitary group, and the CEDA - have united to form the Harzburg Front, as a force dedicated to the overthrow of the current government.

content.content: Hoover Moratorium

In light of the current economic situation, and the German banking crisis, President Herbert Hoover of the United States has issued a moratorium on war debt payments from the Great War, including Germany's. Our budget situation should improve somewhat.
Even though this is not our accomplishment, our foreign ministry is eager to take credit for this accomplishment.
Even though this is not the work of the foreign ministry, it is eager to take credit for this accomplishment.

Wether if because external events, our attempts at convincing or otherwishe, the Left Republicans have decided to collaborate with us again. Let us celebrate reuniting with old allies.

At the Lausanne Conference, the Allies have met with Germany's representatives in order to deal with the issue of war reparations once and for all. In light of the current economic crisis, the Allies believe that Germany is unable to make the reparation payments.

content: Therefore, our reparations have been paused indefinitely! This should reduce the strain on our budget.

content.content: Even though this is not our accomplishment, our foreign ministry is eager to take credit for this accomplishment.

left_split.subtitle: The Left's disagreements with our policies have grown too severe.

content.content: Left-wing members split

Our policy choices have greatly offended the left, and many of their leaders have split to form a new party, the SAPD, or Socialist Worker's Party. They do not count a huge section of our membership, so this should be survivable.

pce_goals_2.title: The PCE presents its list of goals for the coalition.

content.content: PCE Goals
The PCE presents us with a new list of goals for the coalition:
- Expand social welfare programs.
- Continue the land reform program.
- Further nationalization of the economy.
- Make taxes more progressive.
- Continue to support workers in labor disputes.
- Improve our relations with the Soviet Union.

content: They say that they expect to see these goals fulfilled in
months. Otherwise, they will vote to dissolve the coalition.

papen_chancellor.subtitle: President Alcala Zamora dismisses the government.

content: President Alcala Zamora's secretive group of advisors (often called the "camarilla") has turned against
, and Alcala Zamora his dismissed the Chancellor, replacing him with the more reactionary Franz von Papen, an independent formerly of the Center Party.

content.content: Brüning's final straw was his "agricultural settlement" policy, sending unemployed workers to homestead in underutilized lands (that happen to be owned by aristocrats).

Papen is immediately faced with a vote of no confidence, given his unpopularity. However the PSOE votes, he is guaranteed to fall, due to the unanimous hatred against him from all other parties. Meanwhile, he is governing via emergency powers with Alcala Zamora. His first policy is to legalize the Nazi SA, but this does not win their loyalty.

content: New elections have been set for

pce_goals.title: The PCE presents its list of goals for the coalition.

content.content: PCE Goals
The PCE presents us with a list of goals for the coalition:
- Expand social welfare programs.
- Enact a land reform program.
- Start substantial nationalization of the economy.
- Make taxes more progressive.
- Support workers in labor disputes.
- Improve our relations with the Soviet Union.
- Reduce funding for the Reichswehr.

content: They say that they expect to see these goals fulfilled in
months. Otherwise, they will vote to dissolve the coalition.

pce_policy.labor.title: Labor Ministry
pce_policy.labor.subtitle: The Labor Ministry is giving significant concessions to organized labor.

options.title: Of course we support labor.
No, this is too radical.

content.content: The PCE-controlled Labor Ministry is taking a policy of supporting labor in every dispute between workers and employees, leading to a proliferation of strikes across the country. Given the economic circumstances, there are worries that this could harm any potential economic recovery, not to mention the conflicts this may engender with the bourgeois parties.
Do we support their radical labor policy?

pce_rejects.title: PCE declares us social fascists!
pce_rejects.subtitle: The PCEs misgivings with us have lead them to decide they were wrong on cooperation with us.

content.content: PCE stops working with us.

The PCE has always, in line with Moscow, a certain distrust for us. As well as remaining a Marxist-Leninist party. We would have hoped that the recent steps that we both took towards Marxist unity would work out, unfortunatly, they have grown dissilusioned with what they see as our timidness to carry out the proletarian revolution and instaurate a dictatorship of the proletariat.

pce_reaproaches.title: PCE proposes collaboration!
pce_reaproaches.subtitle: The PCE seems interested in cooperation with us, and more.

content.content: PCE begins collaboration with us.

The PCE has always, in line with Moscow, mantained a distance and distrust wit us. We would have hoped that the recent steps that we both took towards Marxist unity would work out, unfortunatly, they have grown dissilusioned with what they see as our timidness to carry out the proletarian revolution and instaurate a dictatorship of the proletariat.

options.title: Try to assuage them somehow.
Could we form a new government based on the Center Party and IR (and possibly PRP)?
Let the vote happen.
Appeal to the Communists to have patience - we are trying!
Could we form a new government based on the Center Party and IR (and possibly PRP)?
Let the vote happen.
They cannot call a vote of no confidence due to the constitutional reforms, but they can obstruct our government at every opportunity.

content.content: Unfortunately, we have failed to accomplish all of the goals the PCE set out. They plan to call a vote of no confidence against our government, and have already begun mounting a propaganda campaign to delegitimize our government in the eyes of the workers.

prussian_coup.defend.title: Fight against the overthrow attempt!
prussian_coup.defend.subtitle: Labor will call a general strike. The Reichsbanner and the loyal elements of the Prussian police will resist the coup.
prussian_coup.defend.unavailableSubtitle: We do not have the forces to resist.

options.title: We will fight, even if it leads to a civil war.

content.content: The Reichswehr and Stahlhelm are already surrounding Berlin, and the SA is supporting them. This could be civil war. We do realize that, correct?
We expose to the public Schacht's dealings with the Nazis. For better or worse, he is cowed, and refrains from taking further actions against us.

options.title: Support alcala_zamora.
Run Manuel Azaña of the PSOE.
Support Ernst Thälmann of the PCE.

content: The presidential election is coming up soon.

content.content: While the position of Chancellor is typically more important, recent governments have depended on the president's emergency decree powers, making the office vital.
The Nazis will run Hitler, while the PCE will run Thälmann. A victory for Hitler would mean the end of parliamentary democracy, and the beginning of an era of unspeakable horrors.

Since Hitler has been deported, the Nazis will run Hermann Göring in his stead. He is widely seen as a proxy for Hitler, who, despite his legal persecution, retains a popular base who wishes to see him returned to Germany. Meanwhile, the PCE will run Ernst Thälmann.

Many are calling for us to support the incumbent Alcala Zamora, despite his well-known reactionary tendencies. Is he truly the best bulwark against Hitler's ascension? On the other hand, many in our party are calling for Manuel Azaña to run again, but he is reluctant.
Another strange possibilty is an united front with the Communists, either to support Thälmann or our own candidate.

options.title: As part of a broader campaign in favor of internationalism and pacifism.
The Young Plan is simply the most rational choice for Germany.

content.content: How should we campaign in favor of the Plan?
The bourgeois parties, as representatives of the rich industrialists, would not have that.

options.title: Give up on leadership of Prussia.
Enact a massive austerity plan.
Use our resources to reduce dissent within the coalition.
Could we get the PCE to abstain?
Never mind. Let the vote happen.

content.content: How do we assuage our partners?
We break with the Left Republicans, the fundational alliance that birthed the Republic is dead.

agricultural_policy.land_reform.title: Land Reform
agricultural_policy.land_reform.subtitle: -1 budget - Break up the large aristocratic estates and give land to landless workers.

content.content: Requires 1 budget.
The judiciary would never allow this.

With our policy of land reform, we are acquiring farmland from large estates, and giving the land to farmworkers' associations and small peasants. In essence, this brings class struggle to the countryside, breaking the semi-feudal property relations present in East Prussia and other areas with large estates. The bourgeois parties and large farmers despise our intrusion into the sacredness of private property, while leftists are cautiously optimistic.
Fine. By cutting welfare, we have reduced dissent within the coalition.

dealing_with_toleration.break_toleration.title: End the toleration agreement with a vote of no confidence!

options.title: Yes, end this arrangement!
No, we should stay the course.

content.content: Are we sure about this? A vote of no confidence would trigger new elections, and potentially an increased vote-share for the extremist parties.

options.title: Change the vote threshold.
Ban non-constructive votes of no confidence.
Reduce presidential powers.
Do not pursue constitutional reform.

content: As it turns out, the Nazi SA has many allies in the police and bureaucracy. Our relationship with the police weakens, and the SA can still organize illegally, right under the police's noses.

content.content: Nevertheless, the SA is substantially weakend by our ban.

economic_democracy.expand_councils.title: Support works councils.
economic_democracy.expand_councils.subtitle: Give works councils a greater influence in managing enterprises.

content.content: The works councils, elected by workers at each major business, have been in place since the German Revolution of 1918, but they have been largely powerless in the face of capital. Now, we will have worker representation on the boards of companies, giving them more influence in management decisions.

economic_policy.wtb_2.title: Continue the implementation of the WTB-Plan.
economic_policy.wtb_2.subtitle: -3 budget
economic_policy.wtb_2.unavailableSubtitle: Unemployment is low enough that the time for the WTB-Plan has passed.

content.content: We have commenced Phase 2 of the WTB-Plan.
We have continued our implementation of the WTB-Plan.

content: In addition to public works, we are now focusing on rebuilding our industries.

options.title: Do not enact any policies for now.

fiscal_policy.raise_progressive.subtitle: This does not change overall revenue.

content.content: Making the tax system more progressive is popular among our base, but it upsets our bourgeois coalition partners, as well as our minimal number of bourgeois voters.

labor_affairs.support_labor.subtitle: Popular among the workers, this will alienate the bourgeoisie.

content.content: Supporting labor is always popular in the PSOE, although many of our coalition partners represent employers, and they are less enthused.

homosexual_rights.repeal_175.subtitle: Paragraph 175 currently criminalizes homosexual acts. We can pass a law to change that.
homosexual_rights.repeal_175.unavailableSubtitle: We do not have majority support for this policy.

content.content: Together with the progressives in the PCE and IR, we have effectively decriminalized homosexual sex in Germany. Persecution of homosexuals for their private acts will stop, as long as the police are loyal to the republic.
Of course, conservatives and the far right accuse us of "degeneracy".

military_policy.increase_funding.subtitle: -1 budget
military_policy.increase_funding.unavailableSubtitle: We do not have the budget.

content: The military and the center-right parties are pleasantly surprised that we would increase military funding. Our membership tends to be anti-military, and is less enthused. Germany's neighbors are watching our military buildup with worry.

content.content: This is not good for the reparations negotiations.

We investigate jurists who have shown themselves to have biased or corrupt behavior, and try to remove them, replacing them with more democratically-oriented jurists. This obviously raises quite a great deal of ire in conservative circles, including within our coalition.

The police have historically had strong reactionary tendencies, and we are trying to change this, little by little. We have improved the training and recruitment process to select for a broader demographic than the traditional conservatives, and to put a tighter leash on their political activity. In addition, we set up committees to investigate the ranks of the police and remove those with far-right sympathies. It is a slow and arduous work.

There are measures we can take to root out reactionary and anti-democratic sentiment in the police. We can improve training and recruiting procedures, and identify and remove known reactionaries and the like.

social_welfare.reduce_spending.subtitle: This will hurt our proletarian base. +1 Budget

content.content: We have reduced levels of social welfare spending. This means more poverty and suffering for the working class. Our detractors claim that we are sacrificing proletarian livelihoods for the sake of class peace with the bourgeoisie. Are they wrong? Are the workers wrong to turn to the Communists, in light of our choices?

options.title: Yes, do it.
No, there is no need.

content.content: Do we wish to shuffle our cabinet? This might upset our current coalition.
Current cabinet:

options.title: To provide a historical record of the events of the war.
To revise the popular German histories and finally put to rest the "stabbed in the back" myth.

content.content: What is the goal of this tribunal?

womens_rights.labor.subtitle: Paid maternal leave policies, equal pay policies, and so on.

content: These policies mean that our party is increasing in popularity among the "new women" who work outside the home.

content.content: However, many male workers develop a backlash towards women in the workplace, especially given the rising unemployment.

content: We have increased our campaigning among the workers.

content.content: The high levels of unemployment make our campaign more difficult.
Adopting the WTB plan gives us a new rallying point around which to attract workers.
The Nazis are just another far-right movement that will die of its own contradictions sooner or later; we do not need to build a specific policy to combat them.

crisis_program.support_centrist.subtitle: Let the depression play itself out.

content.content: Woytinsky and the trade unions vehemently criticize the centrists for their policy. The workers are starving; are we going to callously abandon them and side with bourgeois austerity? On the other hand, the centrists criticize Woytinsky for promising the workers false hope; their position is that nothing can be done to alliviate the depression. They also speak of the fear of another round of hyperinflation that may result from deficit spending.
Our policy course is currently that nothing can be done to alleviate the depression.

Attacking the far right and left is popular among all but the left wing of our party, who would prefer to be fighting the bourgeois parties. This might also hamper our ability to reconcile with the PCE in the future.
We maintain our current dues.
The socialists of France and Britain can influence their governments to be friendlier towards Germany. Hopefully they will reduce our reparations burden.
The Iron Front rallies for the militant defense of the republic against the fascist paramilitaries, strengthening the Reichsbanner.
The Center Party decries the militarization of the Reichsbanner and Iron Front, and its members are leaving the republican organization.
The radical left of the party supports a course of class struggle, and potentially a reconcilliation with the Communists.

content.content: The Nazi SA has disrupted our rally! Their street troops are preventing us from meeting.

Some in our party decry the increasing militarization of the Reichsbanner. They say it is emulating the right-wing nationalists or the communists, and risks alienating our allies in the centrist parties. On the other hand, more left-leaning radicals are being lured to our organizations, away from the communists.
The Center Party decries the militarization of the Reichsbanner, and its members are leaving the republican organization.

The best policy to deal with this sort of irrational, senseless hatred is to ignore it. Few are swayed by racist rhetoric; the best way to combat it is to provide economic security so that people do not turn to antisemitism.

options.title: Back

content.content: The Spanish Republic, called by some the "Second Republic", is a semipresidential republic with both a strong President and Parliment, called the Council of Deputies or the Cortes. The Cortes are responsible for governing, while the President partially ceremonial but also has some important governing powers and responsibilities.

The Cortes are elected based on a mixed representation system, giving bigger electoral lists in each electoral district more seats while making sure that the less voted lists are still represented. The President then elects a President of Council of Ministers, sometimes referred to as President of Goverment. The Cortes than vote on wether to accept the goverment or not. A majority vote-of-no-confidence can remove the current government.

The President is elected by a the Cortes and a equal number of delegates elected specifiaclly for the occasion. The role of the president is mostly to represent Spain, but he also has governing powers. The President can veto laws that are not voted by 2/3rds of the Cortes and send them back for one revision if they do have 2/3ds of the Cortes. The President of the Republic also chooses the President of Goverment and is able to dissolve the Cortes twice, and can thus influence the formation of a government, however, after the second use dissolution the newly formed Cortes must do a vote of confidence on the President of the Republic, if more than half of the Cortes reject the necesity of the dissolution the President must step down.

Spain is an integral nation, this means that while the majority of the country is unitarian, some states have autonomies each of which have their own governments with a number of responsibilities. While currently no autonomies have been approved it is known that the Catalans and Basque wish for one.

content.content: The Popular Front: A New Idea

The 7th Congress of the Communist international begins with recent events in everyones mind. The fall of Germany to a National Socialist dictatorship and the failure of the "After them us" strategy of the KPD and the social fascist thesis. The comiterin, under the strong recomendations of Bulgarian Giorgi Dimitrov, begins approving of Popular Front tactics. Now, Communist parties all around the globe are beggining to abandon their all out war against the other socialist movements and begin favoring allying them to stop the reactionary forces. It would seem that the PCE is rapidly warming up to us after this.
In the face of the banking crisis, we have taken emergency action to stabilize the economy. It might not be not enough.
We attempt to impress upon our coalition partners the gravity of the potential Allied response. The proposal is dead, although the PRP and Center are not pleased.
What can we do to staunch the workers' suffering? It is becoming a hotly debated question.

The stock market in America has had its biggest crash in history. It is too early to tell what the international effects will be, but it cannot be good. Our economy is already feeling the effects - unemployment will rise even more, and wages will fall. As always, it is the capitalists' crisis, and the workers' burden.
Cutting welfare improves our relationship with the capitalists, but it hurts our working-class base.

Wilhelm Marx, former Center Party chancellor and presidential candidate, has chosen to resign from leadership of the Center Party. Now, the party holds a conference to replace him.

The consensus candidate on the right is Ludwig Kaas, a Catholic priest who represents the party's traditionalists. On the other hand, there is Joseph Joos, a leader of the Catholic trade unions, who has been more supportive of cooperation with the PSOE than most of the Center Party.

Finally, the internal contradictions of the FE_JONS have caught up to it. With the improving economic conditions, many business leaders are less interested in supporting them. Tensions between their remaining big capitalist funders and their lower middle class frontliners have come to a head, leading to desertions and public spats. The pro-labor policy is popular among workers and is bringing the PCE more support, but in response businesses are laying off more workers and reducing hours. This is setting the government up for a confrontation with the capitalists.

In an emergency conference, we have decided to become a people's party that encompasses all of the regular people of Germany, not just the workers and urban poor. Demographic Groups
Working Class

content: : The urban working class - blue-collar workers in factories, workshops, mines, and the like. Most are socialist, supporting either the PSOE or CNT-FAI. They make up 25% of the population.

content.content: Middle Class

content: : The new middle class consists of white-collar workers and government employees, they mainly back the liberals. The old middle class consists of independent artisans, shopkeepers, and small-time businesspeople. They tend to be conservative. 15% of the population.

content.content: Rural Landholders

content: : Small and large landowners, the large landowners are concentrated in the south while the small landowners are mainly in the north. They tend to be conservative. 25% of the population.

content.content: Rural Peasents

content: : The independent rural workers and field hands. Usually support the revolutionary left but also have conservative sectors. 25% of the population.

content.content: Regional Minorities

content: Various cultural and ethnic groups with ambitions of autonomy or independence, mainly the Basques and Catalans, aproximatly 10% of the population. They disproportionately support ERC in Cataluña and PNV in the Basque Country.

content.content: Catholics

content: The majority of the population of Spain country is Catholic, distributed amongst these groups, we must be careful on our policies related to them, lest we anger them and the Catholic Church.

content.content: "We all fit in the Republic, no one is banned for their ideas; but the Republic will be republican, that is, designed and governed by republicans, new or old, who all accept the doctrine that bases the State on freedom of conscience, on equality before the law, on free discussion, on the predominance of the will of the majority, freely expressed. The Republic will be democratic, or it will not be."
- Manuel Azaña, Speech in Madrid, 28, September, 1930

juchacz.organizing_women.title: Organizing women
juchacz.organizing_women.subtitle: Juchacz's strategies are aimed at more "traditional" women.

content.content: Juchacz's strategies for organizing women are aimed at working-class housewives, and acknowledge women's traditional household roles. We argue that our economic welfare programs will improve the livelihoods of women and their families.
Unfortunately, women still disproportionately support the bourgeois parties.

options.title: Return to main

content.content: Marie Juchacz

Juchacz is the founder of the Worker's Welfare, our mutual aid organization; her experiences as a single mother in poverty led her to socialism. She is the most senior woman among the PSOE leadership, who is often treated as the "go-to" when the predominantly male leadership sought out womens' voices.

Vorwärts prints editorials in support of Left positions.

all_quiet.allow_protect.unavailableSubtitle: The police are not willing to protect the film.

content.content: Under the protection of the police, the people are allowed to watch the film in peace. Nazi disturbances are kept to a minimum.

When the march arrives in Altona, they are immediately confronted by an angry crowd of communists and socialists, who throw objects at the Nazis. The police attempt to separate the two groups, to no avail. Gunshots are heard, reportedly from rooftop snipers (whom the police believe are communists). In response, the police fire into the surrounding buildings. Dozens are killed. All turn out to be civilians, and the reported snipers are never found.
This incident has been called "Altona Bloody Sunday" in the media. The Communists assail the incompetence of the police, who are supposedly under our command.

capital_strike.propaganda.subtitle: -1 resources

content.content: We have not built up our media enough.
We do not have enough resources.

We launch a counter-propaganda campaign to blame the economic crisis on the capitalists, using all of our media channels to do so. Because of our existing media framework, this is moderately successful in directing popular criticisms towards the capitalists and away from us.

We condemn the events that have happened in Casas Viejas. We go a step further and accuse the goverment of inaction and of responsibility of the events. This hurts our standing with the goverment, but it stems the bleeding of votes to more radical parties even if we are in the goverment.

casas_viejas.title: Shoking events in Casas Viejas
casas_viejas.subtitle: The brutal repression of an attempted anarchist uprising in Casas Viejas send shockwaves.

options.title: Condemn the events, but absolve Azaña and the goverment.
Condemn the events and do not defend the goverment.
Condemn the events and the goverment, our participation regardless.

content.content: A generalized small anarchist insurrection attempt has occurred nationally, in most of the country they fail with little blood, but in Casas Viejas, tragedy strikes. The anarchists, manage to resist for a while, the Civil Guard and Assault guards repression is brutal. At the end of the day in Casas Viejas there are 26 dead and no prisioners.

This has sent the goverment scrambling, and unfortunatly, Azañas first reaction has been in favor of the supression due to him being misinformed of the events that happened, even if he afterwards takes it back and discharges the responsible officer, the damage is done. All this has negative effects on us, as we are members of a goverment that has commited such a purge. Already there is noise to abandon the goverment within the party, meanwhile the goverment is growing increasingly unstable.
The question remains, what to do?

content: thousand fighters with the Communist RFB, in addition to the workers who support the PCE.

content.content: The PCE is entirely on our side, owing to our good relations..
Most of the PCE is on our side, due to their good relations with us.
The PCE does not support us.

death_of_muller.wels_chancellor.subtitle: He is a good organizer, but is he also a good chancellor?

content.content: Our coalition partners are reluctant to accept the new Chancellor, but they do not make loud objections.

emergency_cuts.vote_yes.title: Vote in favor of this measure to continue the toleration agreement.

content.content: We try to convince the workers that this policy is necessary in order to maintain a stable parliamentary government, and to deal with the fiscal consequences of the depression. Still, this policy provides excellent recruiting fodder for Nazis and Communists.

content: proposes significant cuts to social spending.

options.title: There is nothing we can do.

content.content: Emergency budget cuts

content: Due to the crisis of the Great Depression, government budgets have fallen and welfare spending has risen substantially. Chancellor
has used Article 48 of the constitution in order to pass an emergency bill cutting welfare spending.
If we reject this, it would mean the end of the toleration agreement, and
would likely dissolve the Cortes and call new elections. Of course, the workers are opposed to this policy, although it might be necessary for economic and political stability.

content.content: Price controls are very unpopular with the bourgeoisie and their representatives, as well as rural producers, while wage controls hurt organized workers. However, the policies do stem the tide of inflation, at least somewhat.

Potential coalitions:

content: Grand Coalition (PSOE + ERC + PNV + IR + PRP):
Republican Coalition (ERC + PNV + IR + PRP + PRR):

content.content: The rapid rise in FE_JONS votes is extremely worrying. Many had believed that the party was moribound; now, some of us consider it to be the greatest threat to democracy in Germany.
Together, the anti-democratic PCE, CEDA, and FE_JONS have a majority in the Cortes. A stable governing majority will be almost impossible.
There are some potential coalition arrangements.

content: has called for emergency elections, to be held next month, under a caretaker government. The SA is permitted to act with impunity, intimidating voters into supporting the fascists.

labor_unrest.balance.subtitle: Both sides need to share the pain in the current crisis.

content.content: Many workers are unhappy at our compromises, but they will learn to accept that we are all in a shared struggle against economic forces. This is perhaps the best we could do given the present circumstances.

labor_unrest.title: Labor Unrest
labor_unrest.subtitle: Clashes between workers and employers in the Ruhr...

options.title: Support labor in their demands.
Support the employers in their demands.
Try to strike a compromise between the sides.

content.content: Labor Unrest

The mining and metals industry of the Ruhr region is beset by a wave of strikes against cuts to wages and benefits. Meanwhile, employers have started a retaliatory lockout to force their workers to accept these cuts. Both the strikers and the employers look to the PSOE in the government to resolve this crisis.
We oppose the PCE's policy, and prevent it from being enacted. The PCE is displeased, as are the workers who would have stood to benefit.

pce_vote_of_no_confidence.thalmann.subtitle: This would be pretext for a right-wing coup.

content.content: President Alcala Zamora would never allow this.

content: goes to work building a "Soviet Germany": consolidating as much power as possible in the PCE, purging state institutions of anti-communists, and sending street fighters against the "enemies of the people".

being appointed Chancellor, the right-wing forces launches almost immediately launch an attempted coup. Troops of the Stahlhelm and Nazi SA enter Berlin and immediately begin clashing with our supporters! Reactionary officers within the Reichswehr have taken their troops out of the barracks and joined them with the Stahlhelm to stop the PCE from taking power. We are forced to be on the same side as the PCE, whether we want to or not.

content.content: Against all expectations, the PCE's goals have all been met! Apparently the Communists did not prepare for this eventuality, a worker's government successfully built through democratic means. They will continue to "tolerate" our government for the rest of our term, while still acting as a watchdog against bourgeois backsliding.

content: Our forces confront the government troops and their reactionary auxiliaries, and somehow, our enemies retreat without a fight! They were overwhelmed by our display of strength, and have chosen to slink away. Chancellor
withdraws the dismissal of the Prussian government, at least for now.

content.content: The show of force has reinvigorated support for the republic and for the PSOE, and has weakened the fascists.

content: With no other choice, Hilferding has resigned as Finance Minister, to be replaced by a

content.content: center-right
technocratic

options.title: Expose his reactionary dealings!
Work with him to shape the budget.
Hilferding must resign.

content.content: Schacht against Hilferding

Reichsbank president Hjalmar Schacht has criticized Finance Minister Hilferding of the PSOE for his budget, which he claims is unbalanced and contains too much social welfare and not enough tax cuts for top earners and businesses. More importantly, he is refusing to release loans necessary for the functioning of the government unless Hilferding either massively changes his budget or resigns.
Of course, this criticism is unfounded, but the bourgeois establishment does not care.

It takes effort to run a somewhat unexpected campaign. First, Azaña has to be convinced to run. He himself had supported voting for Alcala Zamora, and it takes a good deal of prodding to convince him of his destiny.
The miniscule remnants of the Democratic Party (now called the German State Party) will likely support us. Who else will? Can we convince the Center to support Azaña? What about the Communists?
The referendum easily fails, with only around 15% of voters supporting it. It seems that the German people have a sense of rationality, after all.

options.title: Fine. We will end this coalition.
Unfortunately, we must accept the Right's demands for the sake of stability.
Surely there is some compromise to be had?

content.content: But the crux of the matter is, what can we do?
Fine. We enacted a massive austerity program to cut welfare, in order to maintain the stability of our coalition. The vote has been called off.

agricultural_policy.pro_consumer.title: Food Procurement
agricultural_policy.pro_consumer.subtitle: -1 budget - Provide inexpensive food for workers.

content: We have increased state purchasing of food staples to provide to urban workers and the poor. This benefits workers more than it benefits farmers, as we are negotiating for lower purchase prices.

content.content: Our coalition partners consider this policy to be a wasteful handout.
No. We will not do this.

dealing_with_toleration.urge_against_aus.title: Urge the coalition against austerity politics, and to increase social spending.
dealing_with_toleration.urge_against_aus.unavailableSubtitle: This can only happen with a budget surplus.

content: We do not have enough support for this policy.

content.content: We should have an additional margin for the referendum since we need a majority of voters, and many voters who do not support the republic will not participate.
The Center Party does not trust us enough to support this policy.
We have passed a constitutional amendment to increase the electoral threshold to 5%. This is likely to benefit the larger parties and harm the smaller ones.
The judiciary would not allow this.
The police are too disloyal to be trusted with this.
We have arrested more of the SA's leaders and confiscated their weapons.

economic_democracy.expand_councils_3.title: Empower sectorial works councils.
economic_democracy.expand_councils_3.subtitle: Give works councils a role in setting wage and price policy for entire industrial sectors.

content.content: Sectorial works councils can now negotiate wage and price policies for entire economic sectors, helping to both give workers more of a voice, and to rationalize the economy, smoothing over the anarchy of the market.

economic_policy.wtb_continuation.title: Look back on our results, and continue our implementation...

content.content: Our spending on public works has resulted in a lower need for unemployment insurance and welfare, and increased tax receipts through the multiplier effect as the new money courses through the economy, recuperating some of our spending. We continue to invest most of the new revenue into the program.
The economy is doing better, finally. Even the bourgeois parties are beginning to see the light.
The PCE, however, still opposes our policy of "rescuing" capitalism.

foreign_policy.improve_east.title: Improve our relations with our eastern neighbors.

content.content: We also aim to improve relations with our eastern neighbors, Poland and Czechoslovakia, who are righfully terrified of German aggression. Hopefully we can convince them of our peaceful intentions.
Cutting taxes benefits most the rich and middle-class, who pay more taxes than the working class. Our coalition partners are happy at our orthodox economic course.

labor_affairs.balance.subtitle: Both sides need to share the pain in the current crisis.

content.content: Many workers are unhappy at our compromises, but they will learn to accept that we are all in a shared struggle against economic forces.

options.title: Support labor in their demands.
Support the employers in their demands.
Try to strike a compromise between the sides.

content.content: Labor Affairs

The industrial Ruhr region is aflame with labor unrest. The employers have started a major lockout to force the workers to take more cuts to wages and benefits. There is a need for the Labor Ministry to arbitrate in conflicts between employers and workers.

homosexual_rights.change_sex.subtitle: We can create a legal process for individuals to change their sex, making their lives easier.
homosexual_rights.change_sex.unavailableSubtitle: We do not have majority support for this policy.

content.content: We have passed a bill to allow legal recognition of transsexual and transvestite individuals as the sex in which they live, and allow them to change their name, dress as they wish without police persecution, and undergo medical treatment.
Of course, conservatives and the far right accuse us of "degeneracy".

options.title: Repeal Paragraph 175.
Reform Paragraph 183.
Create a legal process for changing sex.
Do not enact any changes for now.

content.content: Homosexual Rights

There is a constellation of different groups that have grown up around divergences in gender and sexuality, including homosexuals, lesbians, transsexuals, transvestites, inverts, etc. Our party's policy is to support their right to live freely and free from persecution; Magnus Hirschfeld, the founder of the Institut für Sexualwissenschaft, is a member of our party and a major advocate for homosexual rights.

military_policy.reform.subtitle: -1 budget
military_policy.reform.unavailableSubtitle: We do not have the budget.

content.content: Our efforts are at least somewhat successful; we have changed the recruiting and training patterns so that more soldiers from non-reactionary backgrounds can join, hopefully changing the culture of the forces. We have also removed some of the officers who supported the previous Kapp putsch.
The center-right parties are committed to the military and deeply suspicious of our efforts to reform it.

options.title: Carry out substantial judicial reforms,
Carry out minor judicial reforms.
Leave the judiciary as it is.

content.content: Judiciary Reform

The Judiciary is in dire need of reorganization and reform, it is in a chaotic situation and cannot properly enforce many of our laws, be it because idiological opposition or other times genieu confusion and crossed jurisdictions. Many jurists have held office since the days of the King, purposely sabotaging our legal reforms and obstructing our laws.
There is great demand for reforming the judiciary within our party and the left republicans, although this may bring us into a collision course with the center and right.
We have increased the loyalty of the Assault Guard, we have great hopes for the Assault Guards to become a model of Republican loyalty to the other state forces.

content: Corruption in big business is rampant, of course. We have uncovered a number of scandals, and publicizing them brings new attention to the work of Interior Minister
, building up his popular appeal and that of the PSOE.

social_welfare.increase_spending_post_de.subtitle: The increased levels of unemployment necessitate more spending on aid to maintain the same benefits. -1 Budget

content.content: Increasing welfare spending is necessary in light of the rise in unemployment, so we are essentially treading water.

Destroying the "stabbed in the back" myth, in addition to finally correcting the historical record, would do a great deal to improve our party's reputation. This is why it would be resisted by the military establishment every step of the way.

options.title: Restart the inquiry.
Do nothing.

content.content: Cortes War Guilt Inquiry

The War Guilt Inquiry has been an intermittent Cortes committee for investigating the causes of the Great War and the German defeat. So far, it has faced massive resistance from the military establishment up to President Alcala Zamora.

content: We have increased welfare spending on women and children.

content.content: Some of our coalition partners consider increased welfare spending profligate at this time.

content: We have increased our campaigning among the rural landholders.

content.content: The high levels of nationalism among this group make our campaign more difficult.
As a people's party, we have an easier time increasing support among the rural landholders than before.

The Nazis are one of the foremost threats to the German republic. However, we are still formulating a strategy to confront them, and still trying to build up consensus within our party for action. Check back on this later.

Our support of the WTB plan alienates the orthodox Marxists of the Centrist faction, and faces both opposition and support from a variety of sources across the spectrum. Leftists argue that the plan is flawed because it leaves capitalism intact, while some reformists are cautiously optimistic.
We have not yet convinced the party to formally adopt the plan. More work needs to be done.
The FE_JONS is a tiny party right now, with more bark than bite. Many in our party are questioning our choices.
The Nazis are the most urgent problem for us to deal with.
Given the present economic situation, this may be painful.
Dues are already rather high; increasing them might reduce our membership.
Our members grumble at this, and some of the less committed members leave. But now, we have access to additional resources.
Because of the presently high unemployment, our members are feeling the extra burden hard.

options.title: Maintain our current dues.
Reduce dues.
Increase dues.

content.content: Fundraising
For better or for worse, the party cannot exist without money.

The programs of the Nordic socialists involve active government intervention in the economy. We can learn from their economic strategies, and how they moved beyond their working-class base to attract a broader set of constituents.
The Iron Front rallies in defense of the democratic republic and against dictatorship.
The labor wing of the party supports continued particpation in government in order to provide benefits to the workers, and the creation of public works programs for employment.

media.ideological.title: We will have vibrant ideological debate within our newspapers.
media.ideological.subtitle: There will be space for all factions to air their views.

content.content: This has been our media course historically, and it has successfully paved over the many tensions in our party.
We have promised to take more policy suggestions from the centrists. Both the left and reformist wings of the party might be displeased.

It is not enough for the PSOE to solely be a political party. The Worker Singer's League, Worker's Sports, and our schools and libraries are crucial to our members' lives. Funding these organizations makes our members more committed to the party, even when our policies might not be to their liking.
However, it feels frivolous to spend on sports and choirs when the fascists are murdering us in the streets.
After the success of the coalition government with the PCE, they are much more amenable to us.

It is an arduous and contentious process, but we have pushed through the proposal to become a people's party. The Left and Center claim that our new party platform is a betrayal of our founding principles, a turn away from Marxism towards bourgeois opportunism. Whatever the case, we are now a party representing all of the people, not just the proletariat.
Should we run a new campaign to publicize our new platform?

peoples_party_campaigning.campaign_rural.title: Campaign in rural areas.
peoples_party_campaigning.campaign_rural.unavailableSubtitle: We have not enacted any rural policies yet.

content.content: As a people's party, we represent farmers and rural workers as well, and they are becoming receptive to our messages.
The police successfully protected our rally, so it can go ahead as usual.

options.title: Continue...

content.content: The Reichsbanner is already serving the purpose it needs to serve. There is no reason to change what already works.
We do not need any special treatment for minorities.

options.title: Antisemitism is the "socialism of fools". We will defeat them with real socialism.
Antisemitism is a crisis. Direct the full force of the Iron Front against antisemitism.
All Germans will suffer from fascism, not just the Jews. We do not need a separate policy for them.

content.content: Confronting Antisemitism

Antisemitism has long been a latent feature of German society, but since the beginning of the economic depression, it has grown to a horrifying extent. The Nazis are the worst of it, but all the right-wing parties are deeply antisemitic. Regarding the PSOE specifically, our right-wing enemies love to deploy their racist rhetoric against our many Jewish comrades, magnifying criticism of any minor transgression, and they call the entire PSOE a Jewish party. We are a favorite target of their invectives.
Hilferding has been removed as an advisor. The Centrist faction disapproves.
As part of the Iron Front, we are increasing coordination between the Reichsbanner and the unions, and many union members want to become more involved.

content: by Erich Maria Remarque, is a film about the experiences of German soldiers in the Great War, and how they gradually became disillusioned with the ideas of patriotism and nationalism.

content.content: As an anti-war film, it is the target of major protest by far-right actors, especially the Nazis and the Stahlhelm. They are calling for the government to ban the film. If we do not ban it, the SA threatens to violently stop the film from being shown or watched.

content.content: Banking Crisis

The Darmstädter und Nationalbank, or Danat Bank, has collapsed! Along with it goes much of the German banking system. The cause seemed to be due to the government's pursuit of a customs union with Austria, which led to de facto international sanctions.
This is a bourgeois dispute, but the costs will be borne by the proletariat. The people are facing ever-increasing hunger and poverty, and perhaps we are partly to blame.

content.content: Businesses Lose Confidence

Because of our government's policies, which are perceived as anti-business, the capitalists are reducing their investment and laying off workers. This has the immediate effect of raising unemployment and dissent against our government, especially among the middle class.
The business community has a variety of suggestions as to how we might improve the business environment.

capital_strike.nothing.title: There is nothing we can do.

content.content: There is nothing we can do that is within constitutional and legal bounds.
Capital Strike

Our policies have greatly angered the capitalists. Investment has fallen, and factories are idling, preventing the workers from fulfilling their jobs. Meanwhile, the bourgeois press is a constant chorus of venomous invective directed at us and our economic policies.
What can we do?

content: A general strike stopped the Kapp Putsch in 1920, and it can stop fascism today.

content.content: The workers are largely united with us.
There is some dissent within labor, but a majority of workers support the general strike.
However, there is substantial dissent within labor, and less than half support the general strike.
However, labor is deeply divided, and most workers do not heed the call to strike.

content.content: Young Plan

The Young Plan is an agreement with the Western powers to reduce Germany's reparation payments and give us more fiscal autonomy. Simultaneously, France will agree to withdraw its military occupation from the Rhineland.

While this seems to be a positive development for the country, the Right is campaigning hard against this plan, as are the Communists for whatever reason. They claim that any reparations are a form of national slavery, and have organized a referendum against it.
Fine. If the bourgeoisie wish to blow up the government, let them do so. Socialists will not be complicit in the destruction of the working class.

There is also the movement for land reform, to break up the large aristocratic estates and redistribute land to peasants.

content.content: The Soviet Union also suffered from the international order created by the Treaty of Versailles; they have been participating in our secret rearmament program. The Treaty of Rapallo in 1922 affirmed our friendly relations.

The Soviets are asking for economic and developmental assistance. They are still a poor country on the whole, and are desperately trying to catch up to the western powers. There is a chance that our anti-communist coalition partners would be upset, but we could assuage them by asking the Soviets for secret assistance in training and equiping the Reichswehr.

has a proposal for a customs union with Austria. Most likely, this will happen whatever we decide.

content.content: The nationalist right has long yearned for closer ties with Austria, with the eventual goal of the merger of the two German-speaking countries. A customs union with Austria is the first step towards this goal. Additionally, many believe that a union with Austria would improve our current economic circumstances.
However, the Allies, especially France, are likely to object. This agreement would break the terms of the Versailles Treaty, and could lead to economic sanctions, further hurting our economy.

content.content: , especially given the economic crisis

Unfortunately, our proposal is voted down in the Cortes, with the Catholic Center party (our long-time partners) speaking in particularly vehement opposition, and some of our own members breaking party discipline. The activists, feeling demoralized from this attempt, have decided to bide their time.

The Iron Front is our new antifascist coordination front, consisting of the PSOE, the trade unions, and the Reichsbanner. How should we use the Iron Front?

Unfortunately, the Iron Front's effectiveness is dragged down by the PSOE's unpopularity, as the PSOE is no longer the dominant party among the workers. Many Reichsbanner members have left, and many workers are not interested.

content.content: Reichsbanner
Reichsbanner Schwarz-Rot-Gold

content: is a mass organization for the defense of the Republic against the extremists who threaten it. Some would call it a paramilitary, although currently it is hardly any sort of military. It is officially associated with the pro-democratic parties -the PSOE, Center, and IR, but by far the largest component is with the PSOE.

content.content: The Reichsbanner is having a more difficult time recruiting, as the PSOE is no longer the dominant party among the workers. Many of its members have left.

By not fighting, the strength of the Reichsbanner atrophies. Pacifists in the party are gaining the upper hand.
CNT_FAI
Confederation Nacional de Trabajo_Federacion Anarquista Iberica

content: (National Confederation of Labour_Anarchist Federation of Iberia) - The CNT is the second biggest trade union in this country after our UGT. It is a militantly anarcho syndicalist organization, being probably the biggest anarchist movement in europe. They are frontally against any concessions to what they consider the "burgois republic", this of course strains their relationship with us and many others. Given their anarchist idiology they absolutly refuse to participate in parlamentarian politics, nontheless, if they are happy with us they might be open to encouraging their members to vote our lists.

content.content: PCE
Partido Comunista Español

content: (Spanish Comunist Party) - A split from us from the days of October, the PCE is mostly irrelevant in national politics, being very small. Nontheless, it is a incredibly well organized and disciplined party. A Marxist Leninist party, they follow the path of Moscow most loyally.

content.content: PSOE
Partido Socialista Obrero Español

content: (Spanish Socialist Workers Party) - this is us. We are a socialist party of the working class. We are the heirs of the legacy of Marx and Pablo Iglesias.

content.content: ERC
Esquerra Republicana Catalana

content: (Catalan Republican Left) - center left to left Catalan party that supports the Republic. They wish for independence, but for now advocate for autnomy.

content.content: Izquierda Republicana

content: (Republican Left) - a center-left liberal party, popular among the intelligensia and educated middle class. We have worked together closely for the creation and constitution of the Republic.

content.content: PRP
Partido Republicano Progresista

content: (Republican Progressive Party) - a conservative republican party, with support of the middle classes, bourgeoisie and small landholders. We woked together to establish the Republic but later broke with us over religious issues and economic reform.

content.content: PRR
Partido Republicano Radical

content: (Republican Radical Party) - The PRR is a center right Republican party, strangely enough it began as a leftist revolutionary anticlerical burgoise party. They collabrated with us on the overthrow of the Monarchy but our relations have rapidly cooled.

content.content: PNV
Partido Nacionalista Vasco

content: (Basque Nationalist Party) - A nationalist Basque party, they are catholic conservatives, while more open to working with us due to their autonomist ambitions, they are nontheless hostile to us.

content.content: Confederacion Española de Derechas Autonomas

content: (Spanish Confederation of Autonomous Rights) - a right-wing catholic-conservative party, with authoritarian, monarchist, and racist elements. It is supported by parts pf the middle class, big and small landowners, peasents and Catholics in general. They mantain an ambigious position on form of state, refusing to declare themselves Republicans while not calling themselves monarchists. They have strong backing of the old order, having very close ties to the church and landowners.

content.content: *RE* (Renovacion Espanola) - a party recently formed in a split from the SPD, the SAPD is essentially an agglomeration of various left-wing splinter groups between the SPD and KPD.
Comunion Tradicionalista

content: - (Traditionalist Comunion) - The explicitly monarchist and reactionary parties. Heavly authonritarian, they are strongly preatorianist, being in favour of coups and a violent overthrow of the Republic.

content.content: FE_JONS
Falange Española de Las Juntas Ofensivas Nacional Syndicalistas

content: - (Spanish Falange of the Councils of the National Syndicalist Offensive) - a National Syndicalist fascist party.

content.content: Women's Rights

According to the Constitution, women are equal to men, but this is not followed in practice. Women in the workforce are not paid equally for the same work, in addition to often being pushed out of employment after marriage. Men are still favored in marriage and family policy, and there are restrictions on women's rights in many other domains. And that is not to mention the overwhelming patriarchal culture present in Germany.

content: For better or for worse, the Socialists stand virtually alone in supporting increased rights for women, and even within the party, the leadership does not consider it a priority.

content.content: Unemployment Insurance Crisis
The economic crisis has caused mass layoffs all throughout Germany, affecting the industrial working class the hardest. Our welfare spending is increasing due to the greater need.

In the midst of all this, our right-wing coalition partners in the PRP and Center parties have a plan to cut benefits for the unemployed, lower taxes on the rich, and raise taxes on the working class, as part of a plan to balance the budget and discipline labor. They do not see a possibility for compromise. If we do not accept, they could blow up the coalition.

Internal factions of the PSOE
Left

Many leftists are former members of the USPD (the left-wing, anti-war Independent Social Democratic Party), or are young radicals. Many are interested in closer cooperation with the PCE, and some support extraparliamentary action.
Centrists

Centrists in the PSOE are followers of the doctrine of orthodox Marxism as expounded by Karl Kautsky and later Rudolf Hilferding. They seek a middle course between reform and revolution, while defending the democratic state.

game_over.long_war.title: Germany is gripped by civil war.

content.content: Germany is currently in the grip of a civil war, a brutal affair that has no obvious end. Thousands of lives have already been extinguished, and it is likely that the war will not stop until Germany's cities are reduced to ruins.
The current conditions are not favorable for us.
Our cause is popular in the West, but their sclerotic governments are reluctant to send us aid.
The Soviet Union has aided the Communists, but not the socialists and democrats, in an attempt to shape Germany's future government.

Friedrich Stampfer is the long-time editor-in-chief of Vorwärts, our party newspaper, and also a Cortes member. He was historically part of the Majority PSOE that supported our participation in the Great War, but also supports cooperation with the PCE to save the Republic.

options.title: Game over.

content.content: Total Defeat

Our forces are no match for those of the reactionaries. Reichsbanner fighters are quickly overpowered by the forces of the Stahlhelm, SA, and Reichswehr. Many are killed before the rest surrender. Our remaining leaders flee the country or face execution, as the reactionaries take absolute power over Germany.
Our resistance will be recorded in the history books, and in the future, our names will be honored. But for now, all is lost.
Our forces confront the fascists, and somehow, the fascists retreat! They were overwhelmed by our display of strength, and have chosen to slink away. The attempted coup is over, at least for now.
The show of force has reinvigorated support for the republic and for the PSOE, and has weakened the fascists.

Constitutional Reform

Many neorevisionists consider the Weimar Constitution to be inadequate. They believe that the clauses of the constitution are in part responsible for the instability of the country, and must change in order to build a more stable democratic republic. Ideas from both socialists and liberals

A constitutional reform requires either a two-thirds supermajority in the Cortes, or a constitutional referendum with support from a majority of the electorate. content.content: Interior Forces Affairs

The security forces of the Spanish Republic can be divided in National Police, Civil Guard and the Assault Guard. With the army Army and Navy hanging in the background. They all have conflicting and complicated relations both to us, to each other and to the Republic.

The competences of the respective security forces are as followed: The Civil Guard is tasked with the protection of the countryside and the smaller rural towns, it also has a mixed situation, being under both the Interior Ministry while the Ministry of War can influence or even order it in certain cases. The Assault Guard is our urban metropolitan force, tasked with dealing with unrest in metropolitan cities. Finally theres the Armed Police, tasked with keeping public buildings and functionaries, as well as official events, safe.

content.content: Building a People's Party

Contrary to orthodox Marxist predictions, the industrial proletariat is not constantly increasing in size. The rapid growth of the "new middle class" of white-collar workers and the persistence of small farmers and the peasantry confound predictions of a working-class majority.

In order to build a socialist majority, many reformists and neorevisionists are calling for our party to move beyond the urban working class, to embrace the concerns of the middle class, farmers, and women of all classes. We can create a new and inclusive vision of the party that encompasses all people who work for a living, which is almost everyone in the country save the aristocrats and top capitalists.

content.content: Addressing the Economic Crisis

Our party is wracked as to how to deal with the economic crisis. From the centrist faction, Hilferding argues that the economic crisis must be allowed to play out, because it is simply a part of the cyclic nature of capitalism.

From labor, the economist Wladimir Woytinsky argues that we must pursue a massive public works program to reduce unemployment and stimulate demand, perhaps including deficit spending. His opponents, like Hilferding, argue that this plan will cause a return to hyper-inflation, and that it would not even help the economy. In addition, according to Hilferding, Woytinsky's strategy is opposed to Marxist principles.
The so-called WTB plan, after its chief supporters Woytinsky, Tarnow, and Baade, is receiving more attention within the party.

However, leftists in the party argue that the WTB plan is merely a bandage over the fundamental flaws of capitalism. They argue that the crisis is an opportunity to end capitalism through massive nationalizations of industry, and finally bring our country to socialism.

Meanwhile, moderates and reformists draw up proposals for a limited plan of job creation through public works, funded through taxes, that does not involve deficit spending or large-scale restructuring of the economy. Labor argues that the plan is inadequate in its scale and ambition.

With the death of Gustav Stresemann, the PRP is much less likely to be accommodating of us. In addition, the liberal parties are electorally in decline, so perhaps our efforts are best spent elsewhere.

content.content: Inter-Party Relationships

The PSOE cannot govern by itself yet. Because we do not have an electoral majority, we need the support of other parties. Recently, our governments have consisted of the Weimar Coalition of the PSOE, Center, and Democratic parties. We can reach out and build additional connections with these parties, or perhaps we can stand alone.

Our speakers denounce the military establishment and all the spending entering that black hole. Some adventurous speakers question the responsibility of the military elites in organizing the Great War.
Given the volume of nationalist indoctrination in our society, it is difficult to argue so vehemently against the military.
Since we have consistently made pacifism a theme of our campaign, the workers are enthusiastic about our message.
Woytinsky has been removed as an advisor. The Labor faction disapproves.
Unemployment levels have fallen substantially! This is a success of our economic policy.

civil_war.east_aid.unavailableSubtitle: Our relations are not strong enough.

content.content: Poland and Czechoslovakia are largely too absorbed in their own problems to be of much help, but weapons and volunteers filter through the parts of the borders that we control.

content.content: President Alcala Zamora
President Azana

content.content: The fascists seem to believe that they would win an election if one were to be held now, so they agree to our holding an election for next month.

presidential_election_1932.pce_relations.unavailableSubtitle: Our relations are not good enough.

content.content: The PCE now endorses Azaña in the presidential election! We ask them to keep their support low-key, so as to not alienate the bourgeois voters.

economic_policy.moderate_plan_limited_bu.title: Partially implement the Reformists' job-creation plan, with a lower cost.
economic_policy.moderate_plan_limited_bu.subtitle: -1 budget.

content.content: We do not have the necessary budget.
Unemployment is low enough that job creation is not necessary.
We have started to implement the job-creation plan! Funds are sent to build public works projects across Germany, reducing unemployment.
We have continued to fund the job-creation plan, using our funds to build public works throughout Germany.
The bourgeois approve of this plan as the "least bad" alternative, seeing it as necessary to save Germany's economy.
Unemployment is low enough that the plan does not seem to have the intended effect.
The PCE opposes the economic plan, seeing it as a rescue of capitalism rather than a step towards real socialism.

options.title: Do not implement the economic plan.

content.content: Economic Policy
We have already formulated an economic plan. Now we have to implement it.

foreign_policy.economic_conference.title: Organize an international economic conference to deal with the Depression.

content.content: Our relations with the West are not good enough.
The WTB plan has become a popular rallying cry for our party. The workers are eager to go back to work, and that is exactly what the plan promises.
Largo Caballero has been removed as an advisor. The Leftist faction disapproves.
Unemployment is still at dangerously high levels. Even though Hitler is not in power, the situation is ripe for instability and extremism.

options.title: Game over.

content.content: Victory for the Republic

The battle lines hold, and the SA, Stahlhelm, and pro-coup Reichswehr forces are defeated. Today, the forces of the republic prevail over the fascists and the reactionaries. There is a new revolution in Germany. Let us hope it produces a longer-lasting peace than the previous one.
The Array of Forces

content: Our enemies are the nationalist Stahlhelm, with
thousand troops, and the Nazi SA, with
thousand troops. The loyalties of the Reichswehr, with its
thousand regular soldiers, and Prussian police, with

content.content: The PCE's paramilitary, the RFB, is leading the battle, and we are their co-combatants.

content: On our side, we have the Reichsbanner, at

content.content: It is somewhat weakened by dissent within the party, and some members choose not to fight.
It is weakened by dissent within the party, and many members choose not to fight.
It is heavily weakened by dissent within the party, and a substantial portion of members choose not to fight.
Unfortunately, the Reichsbanner are poorly trained and equipped, and will not be able to stand against our more militarized opponents.
We have spent some resources training and equipping the Reichsbanner. Let us hope our people can persist.
We have spent quite a great deal of resources on turning the Reichsbanner into a fighting force. Let us hope that they survive.
What else do we have?

options.title: A no confidence vote is called on Portela

content: The Alcala Zamora is still very skeptical of the non Republicans, so instead,
appoints Portela, a centrist Republican, as chancellor, to try to "tame" the strengthen the Republican center.

content.content: Portela's government is deeply unpopular among all parties of the Cortes. Despite his support for a coalition with all Republican parties, the Cortes do not seem amicable to him.
With the mediation of various establishment figures, new elections are called for next month, without the use of fascist "electoral monitors".

pce_policy.title: PCE policy
pce_policy.subtitle: The PCE ministers are carrying out their policy portfolios.

content.content: PCE Policy
The liberal vote (IR and PRP) has been falling over time, so they will probably be of minimal help to us. For what it's worth, the IR is already willing to support Azaña.

foreign_policy.concordat_negotiate.title: Negotiate a Concordat between the Germany and the Vatican.

content.content: The Roman Catholic Church is interested in furthering relations with the German Republic, seeing us as preferable to the old anti-Catholic policies of the Empire. We are working towards the signing of a Concordat, an agreement between the Vatican and the Republic that formally recognizes the Church's rights and interests in the country. The Center Party is especially interested in making this agreement.
Our liberalized divorce policies make it difficult to build relations with the Vatican.
Our legalization of abortion make it difficult to connect with the Church.
Our speakers have gauged the mood and are speaking to the issues that seem to most affect the workers in this moment.
Sender has been removed as an advisor. The Leftist faction disapproves.

game_over.emergency_government.title: PSOE ruling in an emergency government.

content: The PSOE is ruling as part of an emergency minority government, led by President
. This is a temporary and unstable arrangement, leaving the door open to further authoritarianism.

content.content: A no confidence vote is called on Portela, which he fails to survive, the President dissolves the courts and calls new elections.
Thanks to our good relations, the PRP has promised to support Azaña in the election.

foreign_policy.concordat.title: We can sign a Concordat with the Vatican!

content.content: We have successfully signed a Concordat between Germany and the Roman Catholic Church! This treaty defines a formal relationship between the Church and the German state, guaranteeing freedom of worship for Catholics, and the right of the church to appoint their own clergy. Catholics in Germany are pleased, as are their representatives in the Center Party.
Rosenfeld has been removed as an advisor. The Leftist faction disapproves.

The PSOE has been declared a "People's Party", representing all of the people, not just the working class. This policy has many supporters and detractors, and what will become of the party is still unclear.

options.title: We will form an emergency government with Azana's support.
We will have new elections.
Let the CEDA form their government.

content: President Azana faces a dilemma. Is it "democratic" to let democracy be destroyed, if the majority of voters have willed it so? Some, even on the left republicans, suggest that the CEDA would not

content.content: truly

content: be planning on a restoration, and that giving them power would let them discredit themselves in the eyes of the public.

content.content: Alternatively, Azana could use the emergency powers of the presidency. Though many wonder if such a move is democratic, or if it will genuenly do anything to stop the CEDA.
Influenced by his inner circle and by the fascists in the streets, President Alcala Zamora rejects our offer of new free and fair elections, and again demands that we resign. There is no arguing.
We failed to convince the PRP to support Azaña.

foreign_policy.european_union.title: Take steps to form a "European Union".
foreign_policy.european_union.subtitle: Is a "United States of Europe" possible?

content.content: Our relations with the West are not good enough.
Our relations with the East are not good enough.

Forming a "United States of Europe" has long been part of the Social Democratic foreign program. Finally, we are taking steps towards it. Given our positive relations with the other countries of Europe, we can begin to hold multilateral negotiations for more European federalism. It will take time to hammer out the exact shape of this future "European Union", however.
Seydewitz has been removed as an advisor. The Leftist faction disapproves.

game_over.nationalization_achieved.title: Socialization of the economy has commenced.

content.content: As part of our socialist economic plan, we have nationalized a substantial portion of the economy, beginning the transition to actual socialism.

election_1928.left_coalition.title: Is a United Left coalition possible?

content.content: We do not have adequate relations with the PCE.
The Communists are too committed to their radical ways to partake in government.

options.title: This is impossible.
This could be possible.

content.content: There are enough votes for a PSOE + PCE coalition government, if such a thing were actually possible.
The far-right might attempt a coup, if such a coalition were formed.

march_on_berlin.resign.title: Resign our positions in the government.

content.content: We have resigned our positions in the government.

foreign_policy.european_union_2.title: We can sign a treaty to form a European Union!

content.content: Along with France, Great Britain, and many other states of Western and Eastern Europe, we have signed a treaty to form a European Union! It is hoped that Europe has learned the lessons of the Great War; never again will there be another war that tears the continent apart.

A major component of the union is the free movement of people and goods across the countries of Europe, as well as the stabilization of currency exchange rates. This provides new markets for German products and new sources of investment.
Fascist Italy remains a problem, and the Soviet Union also lies outside the system. But for now, there is new hope for peace and prosperity throughout the continent.
Foreign Policy
What should our foreign policy priority be?

Works councils now have substantially greater influence, giving workers democratic control over their economic lives.
A far left coalition is impossible.

In response to the PCE's entrance into the government, the right-wing takes a "wait-and-see" approach for now. They expect that our government will be unstable and incompetent, and will collapse of its own accord, discrediting the left and eventually enabling the destruction of the Second Republic. Our task is to prove them wrong.
The PCE has taken an abstentionist position with regards to ministries. They claim to be participating as the "loyal opposition" in the worker's government.
Whatever their reasoning is, the PSOE has control over the ministries of government.

options.title: A civil war, then.
